title: Cardiac Arrest in Public
description: You're in a shopping mall when you see a middle-aged man collapse. He's not breathing and has no pulse. What do you do?

choices.outcome: You begin chest compressions and rescue breaths. Emergency services arrive within 10 minutes and take over.

choices.text: Call for help and wait for emergency services
choices.outcome: You call 911 but don't start CPR. Emergency services arrive after 10 minutes, but it might be too late.

choices.text: Look for an AED (Automated External Defibrillator)
choices.outcome: You quickly locate an AED nearby, apply it as instructed, and follow its prompts until emergency services arrive.

title: Severe Bleeding from a Cut
description: Your friend accidentally cuts their arm while cooking. The cut is deep and bleeding profusely. What's your first action?

choices.text: Apply direct pressure to the wound
choices.outcome: You use a clean cloth to apply firm, direct pressure to the wound. The bleeding slows significantly.
You attempt to create a tourniquet, but it's not necessary for this type of wound and could cause further complications.

choices.text: Run the cut under cold water
choices.outcome: Running the cut under water might clean it, but it doesn't effectively stop the bleeding.

title: Choking at a Restaurant
description: While dining out, you notice a person at a nearby table showing signs of choking. They can't speak or breathe. What do you do?

choices.outcome: You quickly perform the Heimlich maneuver. After a few thrusts, the object is dislodged and the person can breathe again.
Offering water to a choking person can make the situation worse as it might cause complete airway obstruction.

choices.text: Slap them on the back repeatedly
choices.outcome: Back slaps can be effective for choking, but the Heimlich maneuver is generally more effective for adults.
